WRITING.TITLE: Never been more angry in my life. Thanks Officer.
WRITING.TEXT:
So I recently found out that I guy who raped and abused me 2 years ago is facing charges. The girl who is pressing the charges approached me and asked if I would want to get involved in the case. After a lot of thought I decided it was time to speak up and do the right thing.
I knew it had been too long to have enough evidence to open my own case, but I still wanted to see if I could help in any way. I contacted the Victim's Advocate working on the case. She told me that I could possibly become a witness of previous wrong doings and testify against him, and to contact the deputy who was running the investigation.
I called the deputy to get some more information on what I needed to do. I told him what case I was looking to get involved with and what the victim's advocate had said. He then started to ask me a few questions. He asked what my interaction with the guy had been and what I was trying to report.
I told him that the guy being charged had raped me.
He the responded by saying, "Well are you sure? Or was he just being a little rude? Because if we was just being mean the law can't do anything about it and you need to go somewhere else for help."
...Excuse me?? I'm pretty sure I know the difference between freaking rape and someone being "a little rude."
If you're going to be working in law enforcement regarding this sort of thing you should probably work on not being a dick. Goddamn police.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm want to help. But I don't know if I can anymore
WRITING.TEXT:
When I was 15 I met a boy who was 18. We started dating.
After a few months, he hit me for the first time. It went downhill from there.
Two months after that, he raped me.
One month later I broke up with him.
Now, a year and a half later, I work at my local CAPSA (Community Abuse Prevention Services Agency) branch. I go to schools and other organizations giving presentations on healthy relationships and knowing the signs of an abusive relationship as well as tips to get out of it. Each time I have girls come up to me and thank me for sharing my story. I love that. I'm trying hard to take my horrible situation and somehow make it a positive. I'm trying to be strong and help others. But truth is, this is the first time I've talked about it to anyone. On average I do 6-8 presentations a week. It's way more emotional than I thought it would be. It's starting to get super overwhelming. But they keep asking me to do more and talk to more people. I want to help. But I'm scared if I don't take a break, I'll break under the pressure. I need to get some help to figure out how to deal with this. But I'm scared to tell them that. I'm scared I'll come off as selfish and unwilling to help.
I don't know what to do.
